trans-unit.source: The DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE statement defines a temporary table for the current connection.

seg-source.mrk: The DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE statement defines a temporary table for the current connection.

target.mrk: The DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE statement defines a temporary table for the current connection.

trans-unit.source: These tables do not reside in the system catalogs and are not persistent. Temporary tables exist only during the connection that declared them and cannot be referenced outside of that connection. When the connection closes, the rows of the table are deleted, and the in-memory description of the temporary table is dropped.

seg-source.mrk: These tables do not reside in the system catalogs and are not persistent.
Temporary tables exist only during the connection that declared them and cannot be referenced outside of that connection.
When the connection closes, the rows of the table are deleted, and the in-memory description of the temporary table is dropped.

target.mrk: These tables do not reside in the system catalogs and are not persistent.
Temporary tables exist only during the connection that declared them and cannot be referenced outside of that connection.
When the connection closes, the rows of the table are deleted, and the in-memory description of the temporary table is dropped.

trans-unit.source: The table structure is not known before using an application.

seg-source.mrk: The table structure is not known before using an application.

target.mrk: The table structure is not known before using an application.

trans-unit.source: Other users do not need the same table structure.

seg-source.mrk: Other users do not need the same table structure.

target.mrk: Other users do not need the same table structure.

trans-unit.source: Data in the temporary table is needed while using the application.

seg-source.mrk: Data in the temporary table is needed while using the application.

target.mrk: Data in the temporary table is needed while using the application.

trans-unit.source: The table can be declared and dropped without holding the locks on the system catalog.

seg-source.mrk: The table can be declared and dropped without holding the locks on the system catalog.

target.mrk: The table can be declared and dropped without holding the locks on the system catalog.

trans-unit.source: DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE tempTableName { columnDefinition [ , columnDefinition ]* } [ ON COMMIT { DELETE | PRESERVE } ROWS ] NOT LOGGED [ ON ROLLBACK DELETE ROWS ]

seg-source.mrk: DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE tempTableName { columnDefinition [ , columnDefinition ]* } [ ON COMMIT { DELETE | PRESERVE } ROWS ] NOT LOGGED [ ON ROLLBACK DELETE ROWS ]

target.mrk: DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE tempTableName { columnDefinition [ , columnDefinition ]* } [ ON COMMIT { DELETE | PRESERVE } ROWS ] NOT LOGGED [ ON ROLLBACK DELETE ROWS ]

trans-unit.source: Names the temporary table. If a schemaName other than SESSION is specified, an error will occur (SQLSTATE 428EK). If the schemaName is not specified, SESSION is assigned. Multiple connections can define declared global temporary tables with the same name because each connection has its own unique table descriptor for it.

seg-source.mrk: If a schemaName other than SESSION is specified, an error will occur (SQLSTATE 428EK).
If the schemaName is not specified, SESSION is assigned.
Multiple connections can define declared global temporary tables with the same name because each connection has its own unique table descriptor for it.

target.mrk: If a schemaName other than SESSION is specified, an error will occur (SQLSTATE 428EK).
If the schemaName is not specified, SESSION is assigned.
Multiple connections can define declared global temporary tables with the same name because each connection has its own unique table descriptor for it.

trans-unit.source: Using SESSION as the schema name of a physical table will not cause an error, but is discouraged. The SESSION schema name should be reserved for the temporary table schema.

seg-source.mrk: Using SESSION as the schema name of a physical table will not cause an error, but is discouraged.
The SESSION schema name should be reserved for the temporary table schema.

target.mrk: Using SESSION as the schema name of a physical table will not cause an error, but is discouraged.
The SESSION schema name should be reserved for the temporary table schema.

trans-unit.source: See for CREATE TABLE for more information on columnDefinition. DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE does not allow generatedColumnSpec in the columnDefinition.

seg-source.mrk: See for CREATE TABLE for more information on columnDefinition.
DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE does not allow generatedColumnSpec in the columnDefinition.

target.mrk: See for CREATE TABLE for more information on columnDefinition.
DECLARE GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE does not allow generatedColumnSpec in the columnDefinition.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the action taken on the global temporary table when a COMMIT operation is performed.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the action taken on the global temporary table when a COMMIT operation is performed.

target.mrk: Specifies the action taken on the global temporary table when a COMMIT operation is performed.

trans-unit.source: All rows of the table will be deleted if no hold-able cursor is open on the table. This is the default value for ON COMMIT. If you specify ON ROLLBACK DELETE ROWS, this will delete all the rows in the table only if the temporary table was used. ON COMMIT DELETE ROWS will delete the rows in the table even if the table was not used (if the table does not have hold-able cursors open on it).

seg-source.mrk: All rows of the table will be deleted if no hold-able cursor is open on the table.
This is the default value for ON COMMIT.
If you specify ON ROLLBACK DELETE ROWS, this will delete all the rows in the table only if the temporary table was used.
ON COMMIT DELETE ROWS will delete the rows in the table even if the table was not used (if the table does not have hold-able cursors open on it).

target.mrk: All rows of the table will be deleted if no hold-able cursor is open on the table.
This is the default value for ON COMMIT.
If you specify ON ROLLBACK DELETE ROWS, this will delete all the rows in the table only if the temporary table was used.
ON COMMIT DELETE ROWS will delete the rows in the table even if the table was not used (if the table does not have hold-able cursors open on it).

trans-unit.source: The rows of the table will be preserved.

seg-source.mrk: The rows of the table will be preserved.

target.mrk: The rows of the table will be preserved.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the action taken on the global temporary table when a rollback operation is performed. When a ROLLBACK (or ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT) operation is performed, if the table was created in the unit of work (or savepoint), the table will be dropped. If the table was dropped in the unit of work (or savepoint), the table will be restored with no rows.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the action taken on the global temporary table when a rollback operation is performed.
When a ROLLBACK (or ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT) operation is performed, if the table was created in the unit of work (or savepoint), the table will be dropped.
If the table was dropped in the unit of work (or savepoint), the table will be restored with no rows.

target.mrk: Specifies the action taken on the global temporary table when a rollback operation is performed.
When a ROLLBACK (or ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT) operation is performed, if the table was created in the unit of work (or savepoint), the table will be dropped.
If the table was dropped in the unit of work (or savepoint), the table will be restored with no rows.

trans-unit.source: This is the default value for NOT LOGGED. NOT LOGGED [ON ROLLBACK DELETE ROWS ]] specifies the action that is to be taken on the global temporary table when a ROLLBACK or (ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT) operation is performed. If the table data has been changed, all the rows will be deleted.

seg-source.mrk: This is the default value for NOT LOGGED.
NOT LOGGED [ON ROLLBACK DELETE ROWS ]] specifies the action that is to be taken on the global temporary table when a ROLLBACK or (ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT) operation is performed.
If the table data has been changed, all the rows will be deleted.

target.mrk: This is the default value for NOT LOGGED.
NOT LOGGED [ON ROLLBACK DELETE ROWS ]] specifies the action that is to be taken on the global temporary table when a ROLLBACK or (ROLLBACK TO SAVEPOINT) operation is performed.
If the table data has been changed, all the rows will be deleted.

trans-unit.source: set schema myapp; create table t1(c11 int, c12 date); declare global temporary table SESSION.t1(c11 int) not logged; -- The SESSION qualification is redundant here because temporary -- tables can only exist in the SESSION schema. declare global temporary table t2(c21 int) not logged; -- The temporary table is not qualified here with SESSION because temporary -- tables can only exist in the SESSION schema. insert into SESSION.t1 values (1); -- SESSION qualification is mandatory here if you want to use -- the temporary table, because the current schema is "myapp." select * from t1; -- This select statement is referencing the "myapp.t1" physical -- table since the table was not qualified by SESSION.

seg-source.mrk: set schema myapp; create table t1(c11 int, c12 date); declare global temporary table SESSION.t1(c11 int) not logged; -- The SESSION qualification is redundant here because temporary -- tables can only exist in the SESSION schema.
declare global temporary table t2(c21 int) not logged; -- The temporary table is not qualified here with SESSION because temporary -- tables can only exist in the SESSION schema.

insert into SESSION.t1 values (1); -- SESSION qualification is mandatory here if you want to use -- the temporary table, because the current schema is "myapp." select * from t1; -- This select statement is referencing the "myapp.t1" physical -- table since the table was not qualified by SESSION.

target.mrk: set schema myapp; create table t1(c11 int, c12 date); declare global temporary table SESSION.t1(c11 int) not logged; -- The SESSION qualification is redundant here because temporary -- tables can only exist in the SESSION schema.
declare global temporary table t2(c21 int) not logged; -- The temporary table is not qualified here with SESSION because temporary -- tables can only exist in the SESSION schema.

insert into SESSION.t1 values (1); -- SESSION qualification is mandatory here if you want to use -- the temporary table, because the current schema is "myapp." select * from t1; -- This select statement is referencing the "myapp.t1" physical -- table since the table was not qualified by SESSION.

trans-unit.source: Temporary tables can be declared only in the SESSION schema. You should never declare a physical schema with the SESSION name.

seg-source.mrk: Temporary tables can be declared only in the SESSION schema.
You should never declare a physical schema with the SESSION name.

target.mrk: Temporary tables can be declared only in the SESSION schema.
You should never declare a physical schema with the SESSION name.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not support the following features on temporary tables. Some of these features are specific to temporary tables and some are specific to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not support the following features on temporary tables.
Some of these features are specific to temporary tables and some are specific to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not support the following features on temporary tables.
Some of these features are specific to temporary tables and some are specific to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: Temporary tables cannot be specified in referential constraints and primary keys

seg-source.mrk: Temporary tables cannot be specified in referential constraints and primary keys

target.mrk: Temporary tables cannot be specified in referential constraints and primary keys

trans-unit.source: Temporary tables cannot be referenced in a triggeredSQLStatement or in a WHEN clause

seg-source.mrk: Temporary tables cannot be referenced in a triggeredSQLStatement or in a WHEN clause

target.mrk: Temporary tables cannot be referenced in a triggeredSQLStatement or in a WHEN clause

trans-unit.source: If a statement that performs an insert, update, or delete to the temporary table encounters an error, all the rows of the temporary table are deleted.

seg-source.mrk: If a statement that performs an insert, update, or delete to the temporary table encounters an error, all the rows of the temporary table are deleted.

target.mrk: If a statement that performs an insert, update, or delete to the temporary table encounters an error, all the rows of the temporary table are deleted.

trans-unit.source: Global temporary tables can be used in XA transactions, but can be declared and accessed only within the scope of a single XA transaction. can support access to the table only until one of the following methods of the javax.transaction.xa.XAResource interface is called:

seg-source.mrk: Global temporary tables can be used in XA transactions, but can be declared and accessed only within the scope of a single XA transaction.
can support access to the table only until one of the following methods of the javax.transaction.xa.XAResource interface is called:

can support access to the table only until one of the following methods of the javax.transaction.xa.XAResource interface is called:

trans-unit.source: When the XA transaction commits or aborts, the temporary table is dropped.

seg-source.mrk: When the XA transaction commits or aborts, the temporary table is dropped.

target.mrk: When the XA transaction commits or aborts, the temporary table is dropped.
